topic.title: Introduction
topic.text: Welcome to the session on Diagnose and Troubleshoot Computer Systems. This session will teach you how to diagnose and troubleshoot computer errors using a flowchart.

topic.title: What is a Hard Drive
topic.text:
What is a Hard Disk Drive?
The Hard Disk Drive commonly referred to as hard disk is the main storage device of a computer system; it is located inside the system unit. The hard drive is where we install our operating system, applications, and store your documents.
Types of Hard Disk Drive connection interface
IDE - stands for Integrated Drive Electronics is a 40 pin interface that connects the hard disk to the mother board.
IDE Hard Drive SATA - Serial ATA or SATA connectors are the next generation hard drive technology, it will replace hard drives using IDE connectors.

topic.title: Removing the hard disk drive from the system unit
topic.text:
Procedure: Procedure:
Shut down the computer, unplug the power cord from the power outlet and remove the power cord from the system unit. Remove the side cover of the system unit, both sides. Disconnect the SATA interface cable from the hard disk. Disconnect the SATA power cable from the hard disk. Using a Philips screw driver, remove any screw holding the hard disk. Remove the hard disk out of the case.

topic.title: Installing the hard disk drive to the system unit
topic.text:
Procedure:
Power on the computer. Press the delete key while the computer is booting up to access the BIOS setting.
NOTE: Refer to your systems manual on how to access the BIOS setup.
Go to the Hard disk detection menu. If you installed your hard drive correctly you should be able to see your newly installed hard disk. If the BIOS is unable to detect your hard drive, repeat the how to install your hard disk drive to the system unit procedures. Exit the BIOS setting.
